item.title: Daily Podcast 2026-02-28
item.description: Robert Bullard, often called the father of environmental justice, argues that researchers in the field have more reason than ever to back up their work with action. | In the late 1970s, Bullard documented that solid-waste landfill sites in Houston, Texas, were disproportionately located in predominantly Black neighborhoods. | Bullard's 1990 book *Dumping in Dixie* chronicled actions by five predominantly Black communities in the southern US to combat deadly pollution.
item.itunes:author: Eva Dai
item.itunes:summary: Robert Bullard, often called the father of environmental justice, argues that researchers in the field have more reason than ever to back up their work with action. | In the late 1970s, Bullard documented that solid-waste landfill sites in Houston, Texas, were disproportionately located in predominantly Black neighborhoods. | Bullard's 1990 book *Dumping in Dixie* chronicled actions by five predominantly Black communities in the southern US to combat deadly pollution.
